feed.title: Sif Sigmarsdóttir
feed.subtitle: Sif Sigmarsdóttir is a journalist and author from Iceland who is based in London. Her book The Sharp Edge of a Snowflake is published by Hodder Children's books. Sif is represented by Sophie Hicks Agency.

entry.title: Niceland interview: What they do and how they do it

link.title: Niceland interview: What they do and how they do it

entry.content:
It was a great pleasure to chat with York Underwood from Niceland who are doing interviews in English with various Icelandic creatives.

The interview is called “trúnó” which is an Icelandic concept which roughly translates to “a private conversation very late at night”.

If you want to read about the advice on becoming an author I would give to a younger me (“Don’t do it! Run for your life!”) and why I wouldn’t have listened, you can read it here: What they do and how they do it: Sif Sigmarsdóttir.

The photo is taken in Highbury Fields, close to where I live, and I’m wearing my all time favourite coat!
entry.summary: Includes advice on becoming an author I would give to a younger me ("Don't do it! Run for your life!") and why I wouldn't have listened.
